en.sc1: Let's look at an example to see the difference between shallow and deep copying.
en.sc2: First, create a Employee, Sam, and shallow copy firstEmployee to shallowCopyEmployee, which is a new Employee reference.
en.sc3: Now, using setName(), update the Employee object's name as "John", which shallowCopyEmployee is pointing to.
en.sc4: If you print out the name of firstEmployee, you will see that the name of the Employee is now "John," not "Sam.".
en.sc5: Now, we create 2 Employee objects secondEmployee and deepCopyEmployee. Set the name of secondEmployee as "Patrice."
en.sc6: After that, copy the name of seconEmployee and set the name as deepCopyEmployee's name. So you deep-copied secondEmployee.
en.sc8: Finally, if you print the name of secondEmployee, it is stil "Patrice" and changing deepCopyEmployee's name did not effect any of secondEmployee's values.
